name: LiEat
description: Welcome to a world in which dragons are born from the desires of mankind. Each dragon is bestowed with unique powers in accordance with the specific desires of their human familiar. One mysterious stranger travels the land, accompanied by a young dragon graced with the power of eating lies.
minimum_requirements: 最低配置: 操作系统: Windows 7 or Greater 处理器: Intel Core 2 1.06Ghz 内存: 1 GB RAM 图形: Integrated graphics 存储空间: 需要 28 MB 可用空间

reviews.review_text: I bought this game because my friend had recently, and he said it was good. 3 dollars was a low price, so I bought it, and didn't expect it to be a good game because of the price. It then sat there for several months, until today, June 20th, 2016, I downloaded it and played it. It was unbelieveably good. It was not what I was expecting at all, I expected a semi-long JRPG with flashy anime characters. What I got was a short, amazing filled story that I immediately fell in love with. The gameplay might be a little bit on the underdeveloped side, but the story beats the hell out of that. I would go into detail explaining the two amazingly crafted main characters, but I don't want to spoil this experience for you. Pick this game up for yourself and give it a play, you won't regret your decision. it only took me about 4 hours to 100% percent it, but it is one of my favorite Steam games I've ever played.

People lie, people die. If you're lucky enough a cute dragon will come to eat your yummy lies. LiEat is pretty short but definitely worth the time.   Cons: Being reminded you will never go on adventures with a cute dragon.

LiEat: ~~~~   I guess everybody in their lifetime has managed to tell a couple of lies (or embellish the truth) here and there. Well, imagine you come across “Leo,” a caretaker, and “Efina,” a demon who is a lie detector, nourishing herself by eating lies. You would probably be in a rather awkward position, wouldn’t you say?  LiEat is a rich story /JRPG game where you play “Efina” and her caretaker in three very well written short stories (LiEat I, II and III). Leo is essentially a con artist who is selling information from one town to the next and keeps changing his name and appearance all the time. Efina was born from a dragon egg; she has the appearance a four year-old child but she is only two months old. She call Leo (Hal, Theo, Albert and god knows what) “Papa” (father) due to the fact that he has raised her since she hatched.   In each location they visit, they will be faced with strange events, will investigate them and aim to find all the culprits. You will interact with interesting characters in each of the stories and even have the ability to read their bio’s at the end of each episode. I like that, as it really reinforces the thoughts behind all the characters in their journey.  There is a combat phase, which is not the big aspect of this game; it is easy and provides you with a little bit of respite between the reading stages.   The Pixel graphics lent the game a nostalgic feel, reminding me of playing on my colour Gameboy. Some people may find the low resolution a bit of an issue but all I can say is, do not worry about it. Great price point, only $2.99 for practically three games. No voice over in this game, however the soundtrack is good.   Positives: ~~~~~~~   - Three short and rich stories  - Interesting characters - Nice Pixel graphics - Achievements and trading cards  Negatives: ~~~~~~~~   - Combat phase could have been better  LiEat series are well written and enjoyable to play (mostly reading). Whether you already like this genre or have not yet been introduced to it, I recommend this series.  8/10  Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!    MORE THE_CPT_FROGGY REVIEWS HERE      FOLLOW THE CPT FROGGY CURATOR PAGE HERE

Loved every second. The stories were short which is no suprise and battling sucked. but tbh the story was what fulfills the game. From the first LiEat, I wouldnt put down for even a second. the Second one felt kind of lackluster but answered some of the needed answered questions. the Third took my breath away as the trilogy has a brillant end to it which makes me want more. But there shouldnt be, its too good to write a 4th one and potentually ruin the stunning conclusion of the third game.  10/10 would recommend for the 2.99 you put in you get like 5 bucks worth in story.  Personally, i think this supremely better than Undertale. Although i have only completed Normal Route i dont find myself wanting to go back and complete pacfism or genocide runs.  I would definitly go back and play this again cause of how much i enjoyed this story  030 bbbbb
A nice and cheap little RPG-pack in one. Very good story. Adorable Protagonists. Great Soundtrack.  A good game to spend money on if you don't know what to do with it while enjoying it.
Cutest RPG game ever.  I reccomend it to people who like to play short RPG games and those who like cute RPG games.

Probably the most cuteness-per-dollar game on this site. Characters are endearing, hunting for clues is fun, the art style is very pleasing. Definitely recommend for a memorable yet light gaming experience.
A hidden gem discovered by chance

The most important thing you should know about LiEat is that IT'S NOT AN RPG. LiEat is a visual novel stuffed in the RPG format.  Combat, gear, HP and SP are purely an accessory to telling a story. They're trivial and pose no difficulty.  This is how you'll spend 95% of your time in the game: -reading through NPC dialogue; -walking from place A to place B to talk to an NPC, or go pick up an item; -walking aimlessly to find place B that will progress the story because no one hinted at what or where it is.  Combat is just padding between the actions above. You'd have to make an effort to die, and you can get out of every encounter by keeping A pressed to basically auto-attack.  I don't have a problem with story driven games. The problem is when they're advertised as something they're not. I think this type of doujin game isn't simply cut for the western market, or at least not for a storefront like Steam... But apparently the other reviews think otherwise.  Anyway, if you can get past the above, the story is run-of-the-mill cute anime; it's nothing special, but it works. It feels like watching one of those random 11-episode anime that you find passable as you're watching them, only to forget them them in a couple of weeks after you're done watching the last episode and being mildly dissatisfied.  The Steam release is made up of 3 shorter games (LiEat 1 to 3) which tell three different stories about the two main characters visiting three different locations and working on as many mysteries/crimes. These all consist in small locations where you run around completing fetch quests, with all the triggers (item hidden in a bookshelf, picture found in a book, note in the trash can...) that don't activate until you've hit a certain story flag, so get ready to search all the trash cans in the area each time you progress with the story.  In short, unless you're a very bored very game-hungry anime fan, avoid this game as it's not worth the time needed to drag yourself through it.

This game is cute.  The game is split into 3 seperate games in the same world. It's an rpg about a mysterious con man and his little dragon girl, Efina, who has the ability to eat people's lies. They live in a world inhabited by 'dragons' and they go from town to town solving problems acting as detectives( since Efina is basically a lie detector), all the while the man sells info for cash. Humans and dragons have a rough relationship with eachother. Dragons are sometimes seen as slaves, however they are allowed to be in positions of power and allowed to live among humans. The 'dragons' in this game aren't dragons in the traditional sense. They are still born from eggs and each can breath fire, but they are human in appearance and each is born from wishes. They each have a special ability based off of the nature of the wish.  The characters in this game are likable enough. The con man, who gets several diferent names throughout, is your typical rogue with a heart of gold who still wants to help people but usually at a price. He tells lies, but with good intentions. Efina is a cute, naive, dragon-girl who sees the con man as her father. Her power is to eat lies as mentioned above. She wants to help her father stop lying one day. The side characters are mostly just there for world building and to help Efina understand her powers. There's the police force captain, Captain Neill, who is also a dragon and he is just your generic captain who is stern and helps people. The vice captain, Brett (also a dragon), is a little more angsty and hates humans. Each game has its own set of characters for that game's story obviously.   The art style is consistant and cute. It's pixel art with a chibi look to it and It's styalized in a sort of fancy gothic way. Everything has a dark outline and it's just nice to look at. The two main character get diferent outfits for each story and they fit pretty well with where they are. The music is pleasant and fits with the setting. However, it's not very memorable by itself. There is also a problem with the music and the cutscenes. When a custscene plays the music will often just stay the same or keep playing even as the cutscene is happening. So something might be happening in the cutscene but the music doesn't help portray it very well.  There is also something to be said about the rpg elements. You get the basic stuff (switching items, leveling, looting, etc.), and you fight enemies. But the enemies aren't random encounters, they often just appear as you progress the plot. There are enemies that you can fight over and over however to level up. But there really isn't much need to, as you just get the levels you need during the story anyway. You get rewarded with money from winning battles. But as far as I can tell, there is nothing to use the money on so it's ultimately pointless.  The game isn't very difficult and is more just about the story. There are multiple endings to each game depending on what you do. To get each ending you just have to do one or two things diferently. There is a detective element as mentioned above, where you have to figure out wether lies are actually lies or if they are the truth, but there really isn't a punishment for guessing wrong so you can just guess until you get the right answer. You can also just find items by looking around that can make you completely overpowered to futher drop the difficulty.   The game is also very short. Each story can be beat in just under 2 hours at most. You could probably get a little bit more time out of it to get all the endings and achievments, but you just need to use an old save to do that unless you want to play through it again.  Honestly though it's an alright game for the price. Short and sweet, not to difficult, and just plain cute. It does have flaws just mechanically but nothing that gets in the way. If you have a few hours to spend I'd say give it a try.
really fun and puzzling - rpg game <3 i love the artwork they made..is .. amazingly great !

You get to play as an info-person. Like, one of those ones that gathers and sells info. Who knew it would be so interesting? Well, I guess thats only because of the insane things you're gathering info on, such as vampires for instance. You also get to learn a bit of backstory on the info-person too.  For the money, I'd say its definitely worth it. That is, if you want a short-ish storybook-like experience.

LiEat is a relatively short JRPG which includes three different chapters, both approximately around 1 hour long (if you're not speeding through the text and really tryin to look into every nook or cranny). If you're a fan of such games as Ib, The Witch's House, Alice Mare then LiEat is probably a game meant for you. Although it isn't quite horror oriented other than for mild body horror, it is a very story-driven game, which focuses on two main characters, a con artist named who goes by many names and a dragon girl named Efina.  There are 30 Steam achievements for this game, most of which can be found on your first playthrough if you're looking everywhere and talking to each character. Such dedication is rewarded with not only more information about our main characters and their history, but also different items, some of which make our heroes nigh impossible to defeat. As it might be evident of my high play time I sought out all achievements and replayed each chapter at least 30 times due to just wanting to explore on my own and uncover secrets without helpful guidances. However, getting the last few achievements proved to be quite difficult, so if you get stuck, be sure to look up vgperson's site, who translated this game, along with many other.  The graphics are adorable and the pixel portraits are very nicely done, so those who enjoy 2D pixelated graphics will definitely enjoy the game. The soundtrack is nice as well, it never seemed to get on my nerves or annoy me after listening to the music for hours upon hours. LiEat knows how to create atmosphere, whether it is to make things silly or horrifyingly dreadful, something which can definitely be experienced throughout the chapters, especially in the last one.   TL:DR;  If we want to go by Funhaus Spoole's view on the worth of games, which is 1 Dollar 1 Hour, aka if you pay one dollar that equals one hour of gameplay, then buying LiEat gives you more than enough content over 3 hours. As you can see I've gotten good 7 hours from this game just trying to complete it and get all of the achievements.  Honestly, the game is just three dollars and if you really enjoy story-driven 2D games, LiEat is definitely for you.
Really enjoyable and leisure game.
Cute, short, 3 different color schemes, cute, adorable, cute, nice story, cute. I'm too lazy to explain things, did I mention cute?
Short story based game. It's enjoyable and doesn't overstay its welcome; the whole trilogy can be banged out in a few hours.
Is good game, great soundtrack, and has its funny moments.
It's fun,
Very Nice Gameplay and Story. This game holds many hours of FUN!
A truly great game!

--PROS-- 1. Beautiful art 2. Rich story line (almost cried at the bad ending of story III) 3. Characters are humurous 4. Love the detective aspect of the game; solving mysteries with a dragon child 5. First story about vampires (got me hooked right away!) 6. Multiple endings 7. Can play with controller 8. The guides for this game are thorough; easy to get all achievements on second run if you missed any  --CONS-- When is story IV? LOL  I recommend this game to all my friends and all strangers out there!  I have also given a copy to a friend :)

LiEat - I finished the first chapter (There's 3 different stories only for 3 dollars and I'm giving it a solid ten for the music etc, idk what they could've done better especially for this price, I want more of that game already)  It does deserve every cents they're asking you for Pokemon graphics Layton atmosphere Light Jrpg fight system Original music 3 chapters Secrets hidden  - Dem feels at that boss fight. ♥
I HIGHLY recommend! If it the developers decide to make a sequel to what happened to our two heroes then I'd gladly buy it. :)

An adventure game with a beautifully crafted story. It is a story driven game and exploration is limited. But the story and lore all makes up for it.  I found myself absorbed by the game's mysterious world. My only complaint is how short the story is. But it is all worth your time !  Highly recommend it for it's cheap price and wonderful experience. You will find soemthing to like about every character !  Bonus points for free and great soundtrack!

When I purchased this game, I never thought I would love it as much as I do.  The artwork is very delicate and pretty, and combined with the soothing background music, I could just stare at the screen for hours.   Anyone who likes to enjoy a pretty game with an intriguing story for a few bucks, is definitely in the right place.

THIS GAME IS THE BEST THING EVER  This game is to freaken cute and super easy to play! The price is great and its really enjoyable!  The developer △○□× (Miwashiba) is amazing and I will always keep coming back to play this game!
Short and cheap, but surprisingly interesting. Plays more like a glorified VN than an rpg. Story is good enough if not a bit predictable at times and has pretty likeable characters.
MAIN PROS - Good Story - All charaters are different - 3 storys (Lieat1,Lieat2,Lieat3) - Not too long and not too short MAIN CONS None (will to me) TOTAL yes you should buy this game

A short but cute RPG Maker game. The battles are quite easy, but they aren't exactly the main focus of the game. Great art and music. Overall I would say a great deal at $3, so pick it up and set aside an afternoon or evening and enjoy the nice tale it tells.
If you are lover of these types of JRPGs, then you should totally buy it. It is worth your time and worth the money. c:
I love this games concept. It's a simple game and has tons of awesome content inside. I would reccomend this game as it is WELL worth your money.

DISCLAIMER: this is not an anime game like that sakura stuff i'm going to be serious about this.... this game is awesome as ****. it has awesome puzzles, a really good fighting system, awesome story and of curse the legendary macaron (I'm serious. its rather a easter egg but it gives you legendary stats). it's definitely worth the money. but it has to be said that sometimes it's REALLY hard to find something. if you haven't noticed by now i am really amazed by this.  it's definitely no game for very body but you can play through it in less than 2 hours so you can refund it anyway. have fun <3
This game is amazing, i would definitely buy more if there are gonna make one again, the story was cute, the fight are good to.

LiEat is an adorable 3-in-one RPG game with charming artwork, an engaging story, and very lovable characters. However, if you are a hardcore gamer who's looking for a lengthy, action-packed anime game that you can invest hours and hours of gameplay into, then this isn't for you.  One thing I noticed is that the story subtly acknowledges real life. It gave me a small taste of human nature and emphasized how lies can consume a person. *Note, this isn't like a Telltale game,* but I feel it's a cool feature in the story regardless.    Pros to LiEat    Beautiful artwork and short animated cutscenes   Creative and lovable characters   Immersive storyline   Cute humor   (You get an achievement for putting panties on your head)     Great soundtrack   Low Price    Cons to LiEat     Short   Monotonous combat   Somewhat lengthy dialogue  Some things to keep in mind --I finished all three parts to the game and found all the achievements in under 5 hours.   (with the help from a guide made by 'Hime~')   And, as you can expect from a 2D RPG, the combat is never that much of a challenge. As I also mentioned in the cons list, the dialogue can take a while.... but it's a   story-based RPG   so I shouldn't really complain about that -especially since the dialogue is well-written.  I recommend LiEat primarily because of its artwork and its storyline.   And you can wear panties and goofy glasses!!   Now I wouldn't say it's an  outstanding  game, but for its price, I'd say it's well worth trying out.  Thank you, game devs! Happy Gaming! ~Xeno
I really love it, the Music, the Graphics and the story! The Story is always kinda easy to understand and the main chars are often really funny.
thanks . its very helping me to lie people
i was planning on playing it quick and refunding, its like a sick hamster, you love it no matter how much you want to give it away.
Great game with a great story. Should last a few hours depending on your pace.

Honestly I Can't Quite Explain How Wonderful This Game Is. I've Only Finished One Part Of It And It's Already Drawn Me In With The Art And Music. The Actual Story Is Pretty Great As Well, And Deffinetely Shows Character Development. I Truly Do Recomend This Game To Those Who Love The JRPG Genre (Also The Adorable Characters And Interactions, The Jokes, And Mystery Hidden Thoughout). I Myself Can't Quite Explain Just How Wonderful It Is And The More I Play This The More I Want To See The Characters Again. If Nothing To Horrible Happens I'd Love To See Some Kind Of Addition To This Game. I Also Wish To Thank The Creators For The Soundtrack That Is Provided With The Game. With How Much I'm Already In Love With This Music I'm Glad They Have Made It Easy To Listen To Outside Of The Game.
Got an achievement for putting panties on my head  10/10
Loved it

Chapter one has the most 'Important scene' of all. What is it you ask?  Why, it's panties of course! Please teach Efina the meaning of life by telling her to wear her own panties on her head!   'Hehehe! Panties!' . . . . . . What am I even doing?     This review is meant to be satire in the first place, I don't regret it.
A short RPG. It was interesting playing through the logic puzzles but, I kind of wish it had a better story arc. It was fun for a once through. I doubt I'll play again.

LiEat is just lovely from beginning to end.  Though it's labeled as RPG, it plays more like a visual novel, laying heavy focus on the story and containing only rudimentary elements of traditional JRPG. It's not hard to find the few hidden items and it's harder to lose the battles than to win them. That being said, the game is still quite enjoyable since it's really relaxing but still gives you the feeling you actually have to do something to progess instead of just clicking and sometimes making a choice like most visual novels.  The story is divided into three arcs each considered their own game, making it a trilogy. While it certainly doesn't deliver the most depth, the lovely characters manage to pull you into their world and make you want to unweave the mysteries and see the solving. There are multiple endings to each arc based on your decisions and the key parts of the story are beautifully illustrated/animated.   Another part about the game that really stuck out to me was the music. Every arc has it's own set of 10 themes and most of them became stuck in my head at first listen. Not only is the soundtrack diverse and catchy, it's also always perfectly fitting the current mood, enhancing the atmosphere in every situation.  Each arc of the LiEat trilogy takes about 1-2 hours depending on how fast you read and how meticulous you search for hidden stuff. While I do wish there was a little more focus on the RPG elements, I enjoyed the game a lot and can only recommend it. 3€ is 1€ per arc, which I think is more than fair.

I enjoyed this game a lot. I wish there was more to it, but I'm very satisfied with what I experienced. Each chapter gives great lessons and at the end of chapter 3, you feel pretty accomplished. Would definitely recommend.
Not totally done with this, but it's very cute and enjoyable. Good story and gameplay, 10/10 for waifus

A very well-made and plesant game, it has the Parts; LiEat I, II and III. The gameplay is really smooth, no stutters or anything. The short animated cutscenes are nice, and so is the art style.   NOTE:This game doesn't have a fullscreen option, so if you want to force it into fullscreen, press F10 while in-game. It also does not have a 'Quit Game' button or anything of the sort.

This is one of my favorite Wolf RPG editor games, The gameplay is sorta linear. The characters are creative and memorable. The soundtrack and art style are amazing. there are three games (making the price a dollar a game). The games are short but it has multiple endings so there's some replayability. I highly recommend this game if you're looking for a small little adventure for a good price as well.
Nice little story.
Despite being a short game, the story is pretty good. You can actually get yourself immerged on it. Not to mention you can equip panties in your head.
Worth weep fot it.
adoorable and fun

The game has an interesting story and it's really cute. The characters have plenty of personality, I see so many games with bland characters, I hate that just as much as I hate not having a good story to follow. There are some emotional moments, especially at the end. I love games...or anything really...that can make you actually feel something. The gameplay is also simplistic, which I don't think is a bad thing. Sure, I like a challenge, but making things too complicated can turn into a bad thing quicker than simplisity can in my opinion. Overall, I loved the game. My only real complaint is how short it is, I didn't defeat it in a single day but I could have if I had had the time to just sit and play it without interruption. Note, my recorded time is not the actual total time I played, I would often get called away in the middle of playing or would be chatting while playing, I had also started playing through for a second time in an attempt to get the rest of the achievements so do not take that as an accurate estimate of time. If I were to give a real estimate, I would say it would take 5 hours at the most, but likely less if you can just sit and play without interruption. I would have loved seeing more, but the content it does have isn't bad for the price so it's not a big complaint.  PROS - Interesting Story - Cute Anime Style Graphics - Good Personality in Characters - Emotional at Times - Simplistic  CONS - Too Short (But, again, it's not a big complaint, the content is decent for the price.)
One of the best Mystery games ive ever played complete with a great story and multiple endings

This game is very atmospheric, deeply entertaining, and incredibly engaging. Each of the three episodes is less than 2 hours long, but the story is amazing. Absolutely recommend this game to anyone and everyone.

Worth every cent. The music and spritework are amazing, with lots of interactions with the NPC's and environment.  The start will take an hour or two until you finally finish a game, but it's perfect speedrun and replayable material afterwards since the game is nice and short. Defnitely recommend.
One of the funnest games i've played in a very long time. Its got that nostalgic feel too it and really is worth the money :)

Ya know, this game made me feel things I never felt before, maybe tought me a life lesson or so. I don't usually even play RPG games, but after playing this, hell yeah. I already knew since the time I loaded this up I was gonna love this game, and if you haven't played it already, I highly reccomend you do. You'll love the characters, the story, the art, almost every aspect of it is enjoyable. There isn't really a single downside i've seen to this game. So please, introduce yourself to an amazing adventure and story, LiEat.
I loved the story! I highly reccomend it for the laughs, emotions and all the great work that was put into the art.  10/10

A beautiful, short game that is light on the rpg but strong in story. Art 8/10  Story 9/10 (more chapters would be nice). Gameplay 8/10 (Either you cheat your way through or waste several minutes grinding) Music 9.7/10 (some songs are better slower) Sound 8/10 (large amounts of silences and no in game audio adjustments). Worth $5  Would love for more chapters even though it is clear at the end of three that there was not much left to tell.

LiEat reminds me of those classic RPG style game. Turn based battle, hidden treasures, attention to details and very well written story with well designed characters. The story is very interesting and you always want to know more.  PROS: - Many unique characters - Great soundtracks - Different possible endings - Great story and good storytelling  CONS: - Game is only a couple hours long (took me 5 hours to unlock all achievements) - You cannot purchase anything even though you can earn Gold from battle. This leaves a sense of 'incompleteness' in the game. - The game is not difficult at all (very straight forward battle system)  Basically LiEat is a short and sweet game with all your favorite RPG elements in it. The game focuses on storytelling more than anything.

Fun game. Short, but for the price, it's good.  An interesting setting for an RPG. Faintly reminded me of Undertale (minus all the extreme detail).  For the price, you get 3 chapters, roughly 1-2 hours each, which have good/bad endings.  Definitely get it if you like Undertale, or RPG's with unusual settings.
Three short RPGs with pretty decent stories.

Technically this is three games, the entire LiEat trilogy. Each game is a relatively short and sweet rpg with a light fantasy-detective vibe. The art is cute or disturbing as the narrative demands. The writing is what really sells these games, though. All of the characters are engaging and dynamic, the story of each game drags you in, answers your core questions while still leaving some backstory up to your imagination. I don't have much background in music theory, but I found all of the songs nice to listen to and non-annoying, so there's that. Those who enjoy stories about growing up, healing after traumatic experiences, and found families will most definitely enjoy these games.  If, however, you're super not into anime-esque graphics, or getting very little explanation for your story elements, then this is probably not the game series for you. Also, the battles aren't particularly challenging, so if you're more into game mechanics than story this going to be another no-go for you. Additionally, I didn't think that any of the answers to the mysteries were particularly tough to figure out way before the characters, but that might just be me.  Overall, I heartily recommend the LiEat series for those who favor story over gameplay.

Definitely a game I'd recommend. It's very atmospherical, has well-written dialogue and a unique concept of fighting and eating manifestations of peoples' lies. A clever puzzle or two is thrown in for a good mix.   Besides an in-game currency which is nothing more than an afterthought, it is almost flawless.
I didn't necessarily have much expectations from the game but after i started i just couldn't stop playing. Definitely try it for yourselves.
One of my favorite games, It's fun getting all the different endings and finding all the little secrets here and there!
A retro-style adventure rpg where you get to have a dragon imouto who eats lies. Good story, good music, good pixel art, and excellent characters. Get it.

I came across this game as somewhat of a 'recommendation'. It looked pretty cute, and it supposedly had a good storyline. So, I picked it up, and I can say I'm quite impressed.  To start off, the game's story revolves around two characters : Efi and Leo. Leo is a man who does nothing but spew lies, and Efi is a young dragon that turns lies into monsters and eats them. Over the course of three chapters, smaller stories involving legends, oddities and supernatural events are laid out in a mostly linear path that prompts the player to interact with objects or NPCs to progress.  The game is strongly story-driven, as the RPG element is fairly lackluster, though the way in which battles are introduced is rather unique and serves the story (the main focus of the game) well. Essentially, Efi is used as a 'lie detector' and must defeat and consume manifested lies as Leo solves a 'mystery' surrounding the abnormal events. Most points of the game are rather cheery and quirky while others tend to be a bit unnerving, though overall the game gives off a light-hearted tone while delivering a tangible plot. Regardless, I thought the story was pretty solid, which is what makes this game what it is.  As far as art and music go, the artstyle is all very cute-sy and pixel-styled, and my only complaint is that during combat some numbers are difficult to read (though it isn't that large of a problem since battles generally exist to progress plot elements and serve as little more than button mashers). The soundtrack is very nice in my opinion; the themes all fit the art very well and while a bit on the simple side, do generally fit the situation.  So there you have it; LiEat: A small story-driven mini-RPG. Came for an RPG, got a Kinetic Visual Novel.
its a very cute game with a cute story the graphics are kinda annoying when its in full screen kinda blurry but i love love this game i kinda ship theo and efi oops
Spoiler Free Review:
Fantastic.  Short, Sweet, and heart-warming. The sound track is fantastic.

Suprisingly enough it's neither boring grindy jRPG, nor your average RPG-maker story. No random encounters, no sudden deaths. And equipement serves meaningful purpose. It's more like 3 simple and cute closed-space detective storie. The game is well-polished and has nice soundtrack. 3-4 hours of gameplay total, worth buying with any discount.

This game is short, cute, and heavy on the feels in some places. Simply put, it is a good game.  For some people, the length may bother them. It can be finished in about 2-3 hours, if you do not go achievement hunting. The pixil sprite design works well, like something made with RPG Maker or that came out on the Gameboy or NES ages ago. The story, about a newly hatched dragon that eats lies, is augmented with occassional still images and mini-cutscenes to help further the plot and immersion. The Achievements are also somewhat interactive, a few corresponding to gameplay choices that benefit you, or make you look like a jerk. LiEat is divided into three parts; LiEat I, II, and III. All come with this purchase. Each story builds on the character interaction between the heroine and her caring yet curmudgeonly 'papa.' The other two reoccuring characters that help progress the story and develop the characters are a pair of policemen. And hidden around the game are hints to the final confrontation that occurs in part III.  Besides the short length, one other downside is that the worlds in each part are small, and you will rarely if ever need to go beyond Level 10 for each boss.  Saying any more and I fear I'll start stepping into Spoiler territory, so I'll stop here. Suffice to say, this is a short game but very good and worth the price. if I had to score, I'd give it an overall 8/10.
Surprisingly great. Would love a part 4 or even another game. This has unique gameplay, cool stylistic elements and an interesting storyline and hidden items. A great game for its price.
A cute little game, albeit a little easy.  I really enjoyed the story and the soundtrack was beautiful.
Nice game.

I paid about $3 for this game, and it was worth every cent. I finished all three games in about 6 hours total and collected all 30 achievements. The game itself isn't very difficult, you just need to be willing to search around a lot, but the storyline is super cute, the 8 bit graphics are pretty, and the characters are all wonderful. 10/10 would recommend! Especially for the price!
This game is really fun, well worth the $3. Honestly this game is probably worth more like $5 or $10.
great story great gameplay. its not long but i think you will enjoy it
Fantastic storyline, adorable characters, it's worth the full price. <3
Quick, easy, and not a bad storyline. 9/10 for me
Efina is adorable.  Feels were had.  10/10 would wear funny glasses again.

An absolutely amazing game. The visuals are striking, the music creates an amazing atmosphere, and the battle system is simple but fun. Where the game really shines is the story and characters. They are interesting and complex, and will definitely appeal to fans the of anime-style characters. This short game would be great for anyone seeking an easy but engaging experience.
Great little game this was... The story was nice and for some reason it felt nostalgic... I really enjoyed it

The characters are fun and lovable, and the story kept my interest throughout, which is a good thing since this game mostly focuses on the story. The combat is fairly easy, it's just the right amount so as not to break immersion. The little puzzles aren't too difficult either, but I still found them to be enjoyable.   The only complaint I could think of is it being too short, but that's only because of my own desire to see more of the characters. The game in itself wraps up pretty nicely, so it's more of a wish than a complaint.  It's something I'll definitely replay in the future, because of the nice story and characters!
Great game! Not very long, but it has a interesting story and with the alternate endings, it's easy to pack a good 5 or 6 hours into it. Worth it!

Although some of the dialogue is a little clunky, I really enjoyed the 3 LiEat games. The universe is set up nicely, and I like the continuation that runs through them (example: in LiEat 1 you get given an object that you never use, until LiEat 2 where it suddenly has a purpose).  I think LiEat 2 ended a little quickly - I expected a bigger ending. But in any case, they were really fun and I cared about the two main characters!
